output: The most memorable project would be the development of a cosmetics recommendation service based on Korean OCR model. This project utilized the OCR model from Naver Clovaai's deep-text-recognition-benchmark and AI Hub's OCR data for pharmaceutical and cosmetics packaging. The use of LMDB for data storage, cutting and training photos of cosmetics ingredients with large text amounts, and refining text using a Gpt Assistant fine-tuned with cosmetics ingredients were key highlights of the project. The project aimed to enhance the user experience in the cosmetics industry through innovative technology integration.

Question: 프로젝트 경험에 대해 말씀해 주세요.
output: During a recent project, I utilized an English-based model to train on a Korean pharmaceutical and cosmetics packaging OCR dataset provided by AI Hub. Due to the excessive text in cosmetics ingredient photos, I had to crop them to 30 characters or less for training. However, limitations in data and computing resources made it challenging to extract complete text at the desired level in the backend. To overcome this, I introduced a method of fine-tuning GPT Assistant on cosmetics ingredients to refine the text extracted by the OCR model. For more details, you can refer to the project repository on GitHub at https://github.com/clovaai/deep-text-recognition-benchmark/tree/master.

output: Yes, I have experience working on team projects. In a recent project, I utilized an English-based model and trained it using the Korean pharmaceutical and cosmetic packaging OCR dataset from AI Hub. Due to the excessive amount of text in cosmetic ingredient photos, I had to preprocess the data by cutting it into segments of 30 characters or less for training. However, I encountered challenges in extracting complete text to the desired level at the backend due to limitations in both data and computing resources. To overcome this issue, I introduced a method of fine-tuning GPT Assistant on cosmetic ingredients to refine the text extracted by the OCR model. This experience allowed me to collaborate effectively with team members and adapt innovative solutions to project challenges.

Question: 혼자서 진행한 프로젝트가 있다면 소개해 주세요.
output: I took part in a project developing an AI cosmetics recommendation service utilizing OCR technology for ingredient analysis. The project aimed to extract text from cosmetics ingredient photos and recommend products to users based on those ingredients. My primary responsibilities included developing a Korean-based OCR model, creating an algorithm to calculate product scores based on ingredients, and implementing a cosmetics recommendation system using Cosine similarity. Throughout this project, I gained a deeper appreciation for the importance of data in AI model development. I utilized Korean language datasets from AI Hub to train the model since the reference materials like Naver Clovaai were English-based. The project was carried out from March 1, 2024, to June 20, 2024, with a team consisting of one frontend developer, two backend developers, and myself as the AI engineer. The technologies used included Python, TensorFlow, Pytorch, and GPU servers running on Linux.

Question: 성공적으로 마무리한 과제를 설명해 주세요.
output: One successful project I have completed is the LoRA-based Fine-Tuning on Prompt-driven Translation Tasks for Korean to English and English to Korean language pairs. This project involved utilizing various tools such as RAG, HuggingFace, Prompt Engineering, and leveraging the Vector DB to extract context for translation tasks. The project workflow included training a translation model using the facebook/mbart-large-50-one-to-many-mmt model for Korean to English translation, followed by a QA model using the google/flan-t5-large model for English questions, and then fine-tuning a translation model for English to Korean tasks. The output was generated based on the refined models to achieve accurate and context-aware translations. This project can be explored further on my GitHub repository at https://github.com/gnssl98/Portfolio-chat-bot.

Question: 해당 전공을 선택한 이유는 무엇인가요?
output: I chose this field of study in order to leverage English-based models and apply them to the OCR dataset for Korean pharmaceutical and cosmetic packaging. Due to the excessive amount of text in cosmetic ingredient photos, I had to train the model by cutting text into 30 characters or less. However, due to limitations in data and computing resources, extracting complete text at the desired level was challenging on the backend. To overcome this, I introduced a method of fine-tuning GPT Assistant on cosmetic ingredients to refine the text extracted by the OCR model.

output: One notable extracurricular activity I would like to highlight is my research project on Community Detection in Various Network Datasets Using Genetic Algorithms. By combining the global optimization search capabilities of Genetic Algorithms with the local optimization algorithm Louvain, I was able to detect community structures within networks effectively. This project is available on my GitHub repository (https://github.com/gnssl98/GeneticAlgorithm) and showcases my skills in algorithm development and data analysis. Additionally, I have also conducted research on split sequence techniques for time series data segmentation and worked on improving performance through hyperparameter tuning and loss function adjustments. Furthermore, I have contributed to the development of an OCR-based cosmetic ingredient analysis tool and an AI-powered cosmetic recommendation service, demonstrating my proficiency in machine learning and computer vision applications. These projects reflect my dedication to exploring innovative solutions and applying cutting-edge technologies to real-world problems outside of my academic pursuits.

output: For my graduation project, I developed a cosmetics recommendation service with a focus on Korean language-based OCR model. I utilized the OCR model from Naver Clovaai deep-text-recognition-benchmark and incorporated data from AI Hub related to pharmaceuticals and cosmetics packaging. I employed LMDB (Lightning Memory-Mapped Database) for data management and trained the model by cropping photos containing a significant amount of text related to cosmetics ingredients. Additionally, I fine-tuned a Gpt Assistant using cosmetics ingredients to refine the extracted text. The project repository can be found at https://github.com/gnssl98/graduation_project for further details.

Question: 졸업 논문이나 결과물에 대해 말해 주세요.
output:
For my recent project experience, I worked on developing an AI cosmetic recommendation service utilizing OCR technology for ingredient analysis and comparison. The project team consisted of a frontend developer, two backend developers, and myself as the AI engineer. Our main goal was to extract text from cosmetic ingredient photos and provide users with personalized cosmetic recommendations.

In this project, I was responsible for developing a Korean-based OCR model, creating an algorithm to calculate cosmetic scores based on ingredients, and implementing cosine similarity for product recommendations. I used Python, TensorFlow, and PyTorch in a Linux environment with GPU servers for development.

Through this project, I realized the importance of data in AI model development. To train our model, we utilized Korean OCR datasets from AI Hub, as existing references like Naver Clovaai were English-based. This experience highlighted the significance of leveraging relevant data sources to enhance the performance and accuracy of AI models in practical applications.

Question: 팀원 간 의견 충돌이 있을 때 어떻게 하나요?
output:
When faced with conflicting opinions among team members, it is important to approach the situation with open-mindedness and a collaborative mindset. Here are some steps to handle team conflicts effectively:

1. **Active Listening**: Listen carefully to understand the different viewpoints and concerns of team members without interrupting.

2. **Encourage Dialogue**: Encourage open communication among team members to express their perspectives and reasons behind their opinions.

3. **Seek Common Ground**: Look for areas of agreement and common goals that can help bridge the gap between conflicting opinions.

4. **Collaborative Problem-Solving**: Work together as a team to find creative solutions that address everyone's concerns and align with the project's objectives.

5. **Respectful Communication**: Maintain a respectful and professional tone during discussions, focusing on the issues rather than personal differences.

6. **Seek Mediation**: If necessary, involve a neutral third party or team leader to mediate the discussion and facilitate a resolution.

By fostering a culture of open communication, mutual respect, and collaborative problem-solving, teams can effectively navigate conflicts and reach consensus on the best way forward.

output:
When there are conflicting opinions among team members, it is important to approach the situation with open communication and a collaborative mindset. Here are some steps to address team conflicts effectively:

1. Encourage open dialogue: Create a safe space for team members to express their opinions and concerns. Encourage active listening and constructive feedback.

2. Seek to understand: Take the time to understand the perspectives of all team members involved in the conflict. Consider scheduling a meeting to discuss the issue and gain clarity on each person's viewpoint.

3. Find common ground: Look for areas of agreement and common goals among team members. Focus on finding solutions that align with the project objectives and team success.

4. Collaborate on a resolution: Work together with the team to find a compromise or solution that addresses the conflicting opinions. Emphasize the importance of teamwork and the shared goal of project success.

5. Respect differences: Acknowledge and respect the diversity of opinions within the team. Emphasize the value of different perspectives in driving innovation and creativity.

By approaching conflicts with a focus on open communication, understanding, collaboration, and respect, team members can work together effectively to resolve differences and move forward towards achieving project goals.

output: As an AI Engineer, one of my notable project experiences involved developing a cosmetic ingredient analysis, comparison, and AI cosmetic recommendation service using OCR technology. This project, conducted from March 1, 2024, to June 20, 2024, aimed to extract text from cosmetic ingredient photos and provide personalized cosmetic recommendations to users. My key responsibilities included developing a Korean-based OCR model, designing algorithms to calculate cosmetic scores based on ingredients, and implementing cosmetic recommendations using cosine similarity. Throughout this project, I realized the importance of data in AI model development. To address the language barrier, I utilized the Korean pharmaceutical and cosmetic packaging OCR dataset from AI Hub for training, as the reference Naver Clovaai model was English-based. This experience not only honed my technical skills in Python, TensorFlow, and PyTorch but also deepened my understanding of the significance of quality data in AI projects.

output: In a practical application, I utilized a text-based AI model trained on English language data to work with a Korean OCR dataset for pharmaceutical and cosmetic packaging from AI Hub. Due to the excessive amount of text in cosmetic ingredient photos, I had to train the model on text snippets of 30 characters or less. However, due to limitations in data and computing resources, extracting complete text at the desired level from the backend posed challenges. To address this issue, I implemented a method where I fine-tuned GPT Assistant on cosmetic ingredients to refine the text extracted by the OCR model. This approach allowed for better text extraction and processing, enhancing the overall performance of the OCR system.
